alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Louisa, southeastern Goochland, west central Hanover and northeastern Powhatan Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 232 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goochland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Goochland, Oilville, Sabot, Montpelier, Wyndham, Crozier, Jefferson, Vontay, Maidens, Irwin, Johnsons Springs, Goodall, Mabelton, Rockville, Dabneys, Fine Creek Mills, Michaux and Locust Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Hanover
